page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: OTHER OLD PROPERTIES WITHIN THE VILLAGE INCLUDE FARM BUILDINGS,WITH ONE BARN DATING BACK TO 1789,A MILL LATER CONVERTED TO A BAKERY AND AN OLD SCHOOL. THE LATTER WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1826 AND SERVED THE CHILDREN OF THE AREA FOR OVER 150 YEARES UNTIL THE PRESENT BUILDING WAS OPENED IN 1981. HAYTON, THE OTHER SETTLEMENT OF ANY SIZE WITHIN THE GRID,RUNS ALONGSIDE THE CHESTERFIELD CANAL. THE CHURCH IS AN OLD ESTABLISHED BUILDING DATING BACK TO THE 13TH CENTURY. THE REST OF THE VILLAGE IS OF MORE RECENT ORIGIN. THERE IS SAID TO HAVE BEEN A CASTLE AT HAYTON BUT THE ONLY EVIDENCE OF THIS IS IN THE NAME OF A FARM OUTSIDE THE VILLAGE.
